messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] what we're reading
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/8/03 11:24:02 PM, abtleo@earthlink.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/8/03 11:24:02 PM, abtleo@... writes:

<< What's the book on the making of the Lord of the Rings called, please? I'm
interested in something like that. >>

Author:
Brian Sibley

The Lord of the Rings: The Making of the Movie Trilogy

Houghton Mifflin

I got mine from Barnes & Noble online. They were so cheap I got six
altogether. When I saw the first two, I ordered RIGHT THEN to get more, and
gave all but one away as gifts.

http://search.barnesandnoble.com/booksearch/isbnInquiry.asp?userid=520POK5K46&

isbn=0618260226&itm=1

The price is up from the before-Christmas sale, but it's worth it.
You might find it cheaper or used at Amazon or in person if you have Barnes &
Noble.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] what we're reading
messages.msgSnippet: ... What s the book on the making of the Lord of the Rings called, please?  I m interested in something like that. And I m also interested in David s new book.
messages.messageBody:
1/8/03 21:25:

> I'm reading _In the Arena,_ the autobiography of Charlton Heston, and a very
> good book on the making of the Lord of the Rings Trilogy. And various places
> in there I find bits of trivia about what's coming in the third movie, when
> they're talking about sets and special effects and miniatures.
>

What's the book on the making of the Lord of the Rings called, please? I'm
interested in something like that.

And I'm also interested in David's new book. Sounds like I'm going to be
investing more money in books again soon! Oh, well, I could do worse. <g>

brenda
who is currently reading guidebooks to Europe, trying to decide where to go
next. (we are due to leave in 18 months now....my travel clock is ticking!)
